title: Elon Musk tapped by Donald Trump to head US 'government efficiency' department
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday said Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk will lead a so-called Department of Government Efficiency alongside American entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy.

title: What science really says on the link between organic food and health
summary: Multiple studies show the benefits of organic food, including lower risks of some cancers, obesity and congenital malformations, even if the number of studies remains too small to establish an unquestionable causal link.

title: UN condemns 'acts reminiscent of the gravest international crimes' in Gaza, as Washington clears Israel on aid compliance
summary: The UN statement coincides with Hamas's accusation on Tuesday that the United States is complicit in what it termed a "genocidal war" in Gaza.

title: 'There are similarities between Silvio Berlusconi and Donald Trump, two emblematic protagonists of the populist phenomenon'
summary: While both billionaires' trajectories embody the destructive dynamics at work in the political sphere, 'Il Cavaliere' never wielded the degree of unfettered power that the Republican elected on November 5 now possesses, argues historian Marc Lazar in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: In Albania, Giorgia Meloni's migrant center, symbol of Italy's highly restrictive migration policy: 'For our remote village, this is a godsend'
summary: Residents of the Shengjin region, situated in the north of this EU candidate country, have welcomed the accord between Tirana and Rome that will 'outsource' asylum application processing.

title: British writer Samantha Harvey wins Booker Prize for fiction
summary: Harvey was awarded the 50,000-pound ($64,000) prize for "Orbital," a book she has called a "space pastoral."

title: Trump announces multiple Cabinet picks and White House appointments
summary: With a focus on reinforcing his agenda, Trump's appointments of the day reflect a strong preference for individuals who have been staunch supporters throughout his presidency and campaign.

title: In France, concern grows over redundancy plans
summary: Layoffs are rising across sectors including automotive, retail and chemicals. Politicians and trade unions are discussing how to stem further job losses.

title: Lebanon: at least 33 dead after Israeli strikes across the country
summary: The attacks targeted not only known Hezbollah strongholds such as the southern suburbs of Beirut, but also areas where the Iran-backed group has not traditionally had a presence.

title: German employees are Europe's sick leave champions
summary: Economists view this as a significant impediment to growth recovery, with several analysts suggesting that the economic losses stemming from these absences could amount to the crucial half percentage point of GDP needed to lift the country out of recession.

title: Pentagon leaker Jack Teixeira sentenced to 15 years in prison
summary: The leak exposed to the world unvarnished secret assessments of Russia's war in Ukraine, including information about troop movements in Ukraine, and the provision of supplies and equipment to Ukrainian troops.

title: Geologist Raymonde Bonnefille: 'The discovery of Lucy was a collective effort'
summary: The pollen specialist was part of the expedition that unearthed the Australopithecus afarensis in northeastern Ethiopia in 1974. In an interview with Le Monde, she looks back at the circumstances surrounding the major discovery.

title: UK's Starmer pledges 81% emissions cut by 2035 at COP29
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer unveiled the new target as he attended the beginning of the climate conference in Baku, Azerbaijan, where he is one of the only G20 leaders to show up.

title: French MPs reject massively amended 2025 budget
summary: The Assemblée Nationale rejected an opposition-amended budget filled with new taxes, pushing Prime Minister Michel Barnier's government to submit a revised bill to the Sénat for further compromise.

title: War in Sudan: The ordeal of those besieged on Tuti Island
summary: 'In Sudan, a total war' (2/8). Tuti Island was a garden island in the heart of Khartoum until the civil war broke out in April 2023. Connected to the capital by a bridge over the Nile, this once-popular spot for family outings has become a hellish place.

title: US says Israel not found in violation of law on Gaza aid
summary: The finding comes despite Israel not meeting several requirements outlined in a letter from the US last month, which expressed concern over Gaza's humanitarian crisis, including the need to allow at least 350 trucks per day into the region.

title: Possible visit of Bezalel Smotrich to Paris causes controversy
summary: Israel's openly supremacist finance minister is expected in Paris on Wednesday for a gala evening organized by the organization Israel is Forever.

title: Strike calls surge across French transport sector
summary: Air transport unions have called for strikes on Thursday, November 14, to protest the increase in airline ticket taxes, while rail unions are planning an indefinite strike starting December 11 to oppose the dismantling of one of their subsidiaries.

title: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby resigns over abuse scandal
summary: Justin Welby, the leader of the Anglican church, announced the move after a report revealed that the Church of England had, since 2013, covered up decades of abuse by John Smyth, a lawyer who organized evangelical summer camps.

title: COP29: 54 African countries, one united voice against climate change
summary: All nations on the continent have rallied behind a common position endorsed by their heads of state, with African negotiating teams subsequently tasked with defending their interests during the discussions in Baku.

title: Drinking water in France threatened with non-compliance due to 'forever chemical'
summary: The country's water resources are massively contaminated by a molecule produced by the degradation of flufenacet, a pesticide that was recently classified as an endocrine disruptor. Associations have called for an urgent ban of the product.

title: Trump's first appointments reflect focus on immigration
summary: Without waiting for his inauguration on January 20, 2025, the president-elect has unveiled the names of the loyalists who will make up his future administration. He wants the Senate to waive the confirmation procedure for these choices.

title: Arab and Muslim countries raise their voices against Israel
summary: As Saudi Arabia and Iran continue their rapprochement, the Gulf States have called for a ceasefire in Gaza and Lebanon.

title: Trump's sentencing decision in hush money case delayed until November 19
summary: A judge on Tuesday put off a key ruling in the president-elect's criminal case as his lawyers argued for dismissing it so he can run the country.

title: Le Monde and several French newspapers sue X over 'neighboring rights' payments
summary: Several news organizations accused the social media platform formerly known as Twitter of running their content without payment.

title: COP29 opens in the shadow of Donald Trump
summary: After opening in Azerbaijan on Monday, COP29 must reach an agreement to fund a 'green transition' of developing countries. The effort is under strain due to Donald Trump's return to the US presidency. He has called global warming a 'hoax,' while the WMO warns that 2024 will mark the first temperature increase over 1.5°C.

title: The debated legacy of Lucy, the most famous australopithecine
summary: Fifty years after this fossil's discovery, its place in the history of humankind is still debated, while, in the meantime, other hominin species have expanded our family tree.
